roleset.name: become faster

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: At the same time , various places have quickened steps of relaxing control over small enterprises .
example.arg: steps of relaxing control over small enterprises

example.name: patient as subject
example.text: [Housing starts]-1 are expected [*]-1 to quicken a bit from August's annual pace of 1,350,000 units.
example.arg: from August's annual pace of 1,350,000 units.

roleset.note: QUICKEN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'quicken' based on sentences in wsj. No access to Verbnet at the moment. (from quicken.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: speedy, nimble

example.name: arg1, argMs
example.text: Firing squad is probably pretty quick , but I do n't know that it 's used much .

example.name: concatenation of arg1
example.text: On his early strike, the livewire winger was quick to praise team-mate Jonjo Shelvey, the man who provided a delightful 50-yard pass to assist.
example.arg: to praise team-mate Jonjo Shelvey, the man who provided a delightful 50-yard pass to assist.

example.name: concatenation of arg1
example.text: It has tons of protein, good sugar, and is quick to eat.

example.name: lexical comparative
example.text: Just finished zapping them again but this time did it myself , found it to be much quicker .

roleset.note: QUICK-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. (from quick.01-j)
QUICKER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from quicker.01-j)
